intro: Paronychia arabica var. breviseta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a low-growing succulent plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It features dense, mat-forming foliage with small, fleshy, gray-green leaves that are typically less than 2 inches in length. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to hot, dry climates and requires well-draining soil to thrive. Its compact growth habit makes it an attractive and hardy choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
